article.headline: Long Beach State 101, CS Northridge 80
article.story: LOS ANGELES (AP) -- Jibril Hodges scored a career-high 27 points and Kejuan Johnson had a career-high 20 as Long Beach State beat Cal State Northridge 101-80 Thursday night. The 49ers (10-9, 5-3) swept the regular-series from the Matadors (8-10, 2-5) for the first time since Northridge joined the Big West Conference in 2001. It was the first time since March 1, 1991 -- a span of 172 games -- that Northridge surrendered 100 points at home. The senior Hodges topped the 24 points he put up Saturday against UC Irvine, going 9-for-14 from the field. He also sank a season-best six 3-pointers. Johnson, a junior, went 5-of-8 from the field and Long Beach State shot 55 percent as a team. Louis Darby added 14 points for the 49ers and Kevin Houston had 13. Jonathan Heard led Northridge with 21 points and 10 rebounds, but Northridge shot just 45 percent from the field and committed 23 turnovers. Long Beach State led by 20 at the half, and started the second half with a 19-9 run for a 68-38 lead with 16:22 to play. The Matadors got no closer than 19 points until the final minute.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
